description: Local schoolchildren were involved in the initiative to "green up" North East Lincolnshire.
title: Volunteers plant 30 trees in Grimsby to create green legacy
title_page: Volunteers plant 30 trees in Grimsby to create green legacy - BBC News
maintext:
Volunteers have planted 30 trees in a park in Grimsby.
Community group All Things Good and Nice raised more than Â£7,000 for the trees which were planted in Scartho with the help of local schoolchildren.
The planting was part of North East Lincolnshire Council's programme Greening Up Our Place which has seen more than 400 trees planted across the borough since the initiative began at the beginning of 2024.
Neil Cartwright from the group said: "We wanted to improve our local environment but we wanted to leave a legacy."
